metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9456 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
In the Android kernel in Pixel C USB monitor driver there is a possible OOB write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9456` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1022-aws - 4.4.0-1022.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-lowlatency - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-lowlatency - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1022.22').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1').
